results.name: Challenge 01
results.description:
A TLS server is listening for connections on the IP address you have received and port number (5256 XOR group_mask). If a client connects and sends an encrypted PMS in the handshake, the server sends an error message stating if the padding of the encrypted message was valid or not. The server does not close the connection in this case, but waits for more handshake messages and responds accordingly.
Attached are:
* A valid padded encryption of the flag.
* The server's public RSA key.
* A few scripts and documents that you can use to implement the attack on the server and decrypt the flag.
Complete the given scripts and submit the decrypted flag!

results.name: Challenge 02
results.description:
On port (5151 XOR group_mask), a server like the server in Bleichenbacher challenge 1 is listening.
However, if you query it too many times in one connection, it will close the connection and stop accepting new connections for a while. The good news is that the server can handle several connections simultaneously.
Attached is a script that can help you exploit this fact and run your attack on this server, as well.

results.name: Challenge 03
results.description: A TLS server is listening on port (7856 XOR group_mask). This server is more sophisticated and does not send different error messages according to the padding of the encrypted PMS. However, on valid padding, it takes longer to respond. Use this, the scripts attached and your previous implementation of the attack to decrypt the flag!
